source_paper: Penske et al. (2023) - Ancient genomes reveal social and genetic structure of Late Neolithic Switzerland

overall_summary.assessment_scope: Complete verification of all extracted items and relationships with bidirectional mapping integrity analysis
overall_summary.overall_assessment: Strong content quality (A- accuracy, A granularity) severely undermined by extensive bidirectional mapping inconsistencies (C mapping). Requires systematic mapping reconciliation before suitable for replicability assessment.

pass_a_accuracy_detailed.summary: Overall accuracy 95.2% - High quality extraction with minor linkage and data quality issues

evidence.notes: E015 has duplicate mapping. Consolidation metadata quality varies but consolidations themselves appropriate.

claims.notes: 8 claims lack supporting evidence (C006 appropriately as knowledge_gap claim). Some require reclassification or evidence linking.

methods.notes: M001 has duplicate design mapping. 4 methods lack design mappings (M017-M020).

research_designs.notes: Perfect accuracy with excellent consolidation (RD002) and appropriate implicit design identification (RD008)

errors_identified.issue: Claims require evidence support but have no linkages. C023→E013, C084→E004/E025/E028 clear cases. C004/C005 may need reclassification to background_synthesis. C014/C078/C082 need synthesis evidence linked.
errors_identified.corrective_action: Add missing evidence linkages where evidence exists, or reclassify claims as background_synthesis where appropriate. C006 (knowledge_gap) correctly has no evidence.

errors_identified.description: 4 methods have null or empty implements_designs arrays
errors_identified.issue: M017 (model_selection), M018 (quality_control), M019 (classification) should link to RD006 or RD004. M020 (visualization) status unclear.
errors_identified.corrective_action: Link M017/M019 to RD006, M018 to RD004, clarify M020 status

errors_identified.issue: Some claim_type values not consistently applied (e.g., 'assessment', 'historiographic_impact')
errors_identified.corrective_action: Standardise claim_type taxonomy or document custom types

pass_b_granularity_detailed.summary: Overall granularity 98.7% - Excellent editorial judgment with appropriate consolidation and no over-splitting

issues_identified.description: Three distinct resource types (copper, gold, salt) combined
issues_identified.assessment: Acceptable as consolidated economic pattern unless paper discusses resources independently with separate evidence
issues_identified.recommendation: Verify against source - if resources discussed independently, consider splitting

issues_identified.description: Two tissue types (petrous bones, teeth) combined at method level
issues_identified.assessment: Acceptable - tissue-specific detail appropriately delegated to protocol level (P003)
issues_identified.recommendation: No action - RDMAP hierarchy appropriately places variation at protocol level

issues_identified.description: Database (IntCal20) and software (OxCal) combined in single protocol
issues_identified.assessment: Acceptable - functionally inseparable components of calibration protocol
issues_identified.recommendation: No action - cannot assess database independently of software

key_findings: No over-splitting detected - strong editorial judgment on consolidation
Evidence consolidation exemplary (98.8%) with 8 appropriate consolidations
RDMAP hierarchy shows clear granularity differentiation: Design (119 chars avg) → Method (84 chars) → Protocol (89 chars)
Consistent detail levels within types (genetic observations, archaeological patterns, statistical tests)
Conservative consolidation approach (9.4% evidence, 1.2% claims, 2.9% protocols, 14.3% designs consolidated)
All consolidations have metadata with clear rationale
Functional usefulness maintained - items independently assessable

pass_c_mapping_detailed.summary: Overall mapping quality 75.0% - CRITICAL: Extensive bidirectional mapping inconsistencies severely undermine otherwise sound conceptual relationships

critical_issues.description: 62 bidirectional mapping inconsistencies across all relationship types
critical_issues.impact: Creates data integrity problems, assessment ambiguity, and undermines RDMAP hierarchy traceability

critical_issues.description: 7 items reference non-existent IDs (orphaned references from consolidation)
critical_issues.impact: Broken references prevent reliable relationship assessment
RDMAP hierarchy completely broken at protocol level, preventing protocol traceability

root_cause_analysis.explanation: When Pass 1 items were consolidated in Pass 2+, forward and reverse mappings were not systematically updated to reflect new consolidated IDs
contributing_factors: Asymmetric mapping updates (one direction updated without reverse)
Protocol extraction or ID numbering issues
Missing protocols (P004, P012, P020) or ID mismatches
Consolidation metadata documented but references not updated

examples: C023 → E013 (missing linkage, flagged in Pass A)
C025 → E020 (E020 doesn't exist, consolidated into E019)
E006 → C015 (claim doesn't link back, potentially weak link)
issues_identified.pattern: Claims reference consolidated evidence using old IDs, or evidence added without updating claims

examples: M009-M015 → RD006 (7 methods claim RD006 but RD006 doesn't list them)
RD001 → M002 (RD001 lists M002 but M002 doesn't list RD001)
M015 implements RD006 but should also implement RD008
issues_identified.pattern: Multiple analytical methods (M009-M015) claim to implement RD006 but not reciprocated
Systematic protocol-method mapping failure with ID mismatches and missing protocols

key_findings: CRITICAL: 0% protocol-method bidirectional consistency - severe structural failure
CRITICAL: 47% method-design bidirectional consistency - major integrity problem
SIGNIFICANT: 80% claim-evidence bidirectional consistency - recoverable but requires work
7 missing item references creating orphaned mappings
Conceptual RDMAP hierarchy is sound, but implementation broken

priority_corrections.action: Update all claims/methods referencing non-existent items
priority_corrections.impact: Eliminates broken references, enables reliable mapping assessment

requirements: Identify and add any truly missing protocols (P004, P012, P020)
Correct ID mismatches (P010→M005 not M014, P011→M006 not M007)
priority_corrections.impact: Restores RDMAP hierarchy integrity, enables protocol traceability

tasks: Add M009, M010, M011, M013, M014, M015 to RD006.supported_by_methods
Add missing reverse mappings (C007→E001/E003, C008→E001, C009→E002, etc.)
Update claims referencing consolidated evidence (C025→E019, C027→E021)
Remove weak/tangential links (E006→C015 if too indirect)
Add evidence to synthesis claims (C078, C082, C084)
Link unsupported claims to appropriate evidence

patterns_identified.pattern: Strong content quality undermined by mapping issues
patterns_identified.description: Excellent accuracy (95.2%) and granularity (98.7%) with perfect RDMAP conceptual hierarchy, but severe bidirectional mapping inconsistencies (75.0%)
patterns_identified.significance: Content extraction is high quality, but relationship mapping systematically broken during consolidation

patterns_identified.description: When Pass 1 items consolidated, mappings not fully updated in both forward and reverse directions
patterns_identified.significance: Root cause of 62 bidirectional inconsistencies and 7 orphaned references

patterns_identified.description: 0% bidirectional consistency in protocol-method mappings with systematic ID mismatches
patterns_identified.significance: Complete failure of RDMAP hierarchy at protocol level - cannot trace methods to implementing protocols

patterns_identified.description: 11 consolidations, all have consolidation_metadata with clear rationale
patterns_identified.significance: Strong editorial judgment on what to consolidate, but implementation (updating references) incomplete

patterns_identified.description: 100% accuracy for protocols and research designs with no errors
patterns_identified.significance: RDMAP components extracted with high quality at content level

patterns_identified.description: 8 claims lack evidence support, some appropriately (C006 knowledge_gap), others need links/reclassification
patterns_identified.significance: Need systematic review of unsupported claims

patterns_identified.description: Zero over-split items across all categories
patterns_identified.significance: Conservative consolidation approach successfully avoids unnecessary fragmentation

overall_assessment.quality_tier: Mixed - Strong content quality (A-), severe mapping issues (C)
strengths: Excellent accuracy (95.2%) with perfect protocols and designs
Strong consolidation quality with clear documentation (11 consolidations)
Sound conceptual RDMAP hierarchy (design → method → protocol)
Conservative editorial judgment balancing atomic principle with usefulness
Clear granularity differentiation across RDMAP levels
critical_weaknesses: 0% protocol-method bidirectional consistency - complete structural failure
47% method-design bidirectional consistency - major integrity problem
80% claim-evidence bidirectional consistency - significant but recoverable
7 missing item references (orphaned mappings from consolidation)
RDMAP hierarchy implementation broken despite sound conceptual structure
moderate_weaknesses: 8 claims lack evidence support (some need reclassification, others need links)
recommendations: PRIORITY 1 (CRITICAL): Fix 7 missing item references (broken consolidated IDs)
PRIORITY 2 (CRITICAL): Completely rebuild protocol-method mappings (0% consistency)
PRIORITY 5 (MODERATE): Address Pass A accuracy refinements
Systematic consolidation reconciliation protocol needed for future extractions
Implement bidirectional consistency checks during extraction workflow
overall_assessment.fitness_for_use: NOT SUITABLE for replicability assessment without major corrections. While content quality is excellent (A- accuracy, A granularity), bidirectional mapping inconsistencies create fundamental data integrity problems. The extraction requires systematic mapping reconciliation across all relationship types, particularly complete rebuild of protocol-method mappings (0% consistency) and significant repairs to method-design (47% consistency) and claim-evidence (80% consistency) mappings. Estimated correction effort: HIGH (62+ bidirectional inconsistencies plus systematic protocol-method rebuild required).
overall_assessment.estimated_correction_effort:
High - Approximately 40-60 hours for systematic mapping reconciliation:
- 4 hours: Fix 7 missing item references
- 20-30 hours: Rebuild protocol-method mappings (0% consistency)
- 8-10 hours: Reconcile method-design mappings (10 issues)
- 6-8 hours: Reconcile claim-evidence mappings (20 issues)
- 2-4 hours: Address accuracy refinements
- 4-6 hours: Verification and validation
